lender.occupational_info:
DEMOCRATIC PARTY ACTIVITIES Supervisor; Rock Island County Board-District #20 Chairman; Rock Island Democratic Minority Caucus Committee to Elect Carol Moseley-Braun (became active prior to the March primary & continued through to the election) Coordinator of 14 Precincts in the City of Rock Island in the Nov. 3, 1992 Election Precinct Committeeman, South Rock Island #1 1976-Present Deputy registrar for Rock Island County, 1976-Present Delegate to the State Democratic Convention, 1978-1996 Delegate to the Young Democrats National Convention, 1979 Treasurer, Young Democrats of Illinois, 1979 William Dawson Award Winner, 1981, Young Democrats of Illinois Delegate-Democrat National Convention 2008, Denver, Co.
COMMUNITY ACTIVITIES Past-Vicej President-Metro Branch N.A.A.C.P. Past- Vice President- A. Phillip Randolph Institute Member S.C.L.C. (Southern Christian Leadership Conference) Executive Board, Q-C League of Native Americans Past- Executive Board- Horace Mann Choice Elementary School Past- Executive Board- Quad City Alliance for Justice Rock Island Township Court Watch- Member Docent- Davenport Museum of Art Past- Member, Board of Directors,John Deere Plow & Planter Employee's Credit Union & Chairman of the Delinquency Committee Past- Chairman, Bi-State Metropolitan Computer Security and Privacy Commission Past- Chairman, Martin Luther King Center Advisory Board Past- Member, Bi-State Metropolitan Planning Commission Past- President, Rock Island County N.A.A.C.P. Church-Olivet Baptist, 115-21st Avenue, Rock Island. Past-Member Child Abuse Council Board Member-Arrowhead Ranch Board Member- University of Illinois Extension Service Member- A.C.T.I.V.E. Club (Senior Citizens) Rock Island Rock Island County Forest Preserve Past- Member- Congressman Lane Evans Military Scholarship Board Member 14th Judicial District Task Force on Juvenile Detention Past- President and Member- Community Caring Conference Founding Member, Council on Children at Risk IHSA and IHSAA Registered Basketball Official for 26 Years
LABOR AFFILIATION AND ACTIVITIES
Member Quad City Federation of Labor
United Auto Workers Local 434, 1965-1972 Union Time Study Representative, (The First Black Native American Quality Control Inspector)
Patternmaker League of North America, 1972-1991, Shop Committee and Pension Board member. (First Black Native American Patternmaker in the World)
Retired- International Association of Machinists Lodge #2825 Member 1991-2007
EDUCATION

Scott Community College,Bettendorf,IA Courses in Labor History, International Trade & Export, and Auto Sales
Allied Institute of Technology,Chicago,IL Completed One Year Certificate in Engineering Drafting Technology
St. Ambrose University, Davenport, IA Courses in Supervisory Development & Small Business Management
EMPLOYMENT
1965-2007 Patternmaker John Deere 42 Year Service-Retired
1965 Colt Industry-Fairbanks Morse Scale Division
References Furnished Upon Request.
